Definition: You will be given reviews from Amazon. Your task is to classify them into two classes: Negative or Positive.

Positive Examples.input: I've read this book with much expectation, it was very boring all through out the book
Positive Examples.explanation: Review writer does not like the book because it was boring, therefore it is a negative review.

Positive Examples.input: I believe I will be very happy with the camcorder. Its small,light and easy to handle.The LCD is clear and bright.Ease of operation.
Positive Examples.explanation: There are positive words in the review like "very happy", "easy to handle", therefore it is a positive review.

Positive Examples.input: love it...very touch.it's to bad that in the dvd description doesn't mention no subtitles
Positive Examples.explanation: There are positive words in the review like "love it", "very touch", therefore it is classified as positive review. Pay attention that although the reviewer is not happy that it's not mentioned that there are no subtitles, the overall polarity of the review is positive.

Negative Examples.input: It starts off a bit slow, but once the product placement jokes start it takes off.
Negative Examples.explanation: This review is positive review since it says that after product placement joke it becomes interesting.

Negative Examples.input: As good as this book may be, the print quality is so bad that I cannot read it. Zero stars would have been more appropriate.
Negative Examples.explanation: This is a negative review. because the print quality of book is very bad and not readable.

Negative Examples.input: I love it, it's LONG and the connection is secure and it doesn't get hot! It's wonderful!
Negative Examples.explanation: This is a positive review because it says "I love it" and "It's wonderful".

Instances.input: While I do admit that these stories are no longer capable of scaring me, I also understand the fact that...this is a children's book. That being said, if you are not 12 and under, you might find some of the stories rather bland-- especially if you're a serious horror fan.Anyway, this book is great for campfire/sleepover/Halloween party-type settings. They're pretty short, but still quite enjoyable. My father read these books to my siblings and I as children during the month of October, and they scared the crap out of us.The illustrations....weird, scary, freaky stuff. Bottom line. In my opinion, the pictures are even scarier than the actual stories. I'm 26 now, and some of them still creep me out to this very day. So, if you're intending to read these stories aloud, then make sure that you show the pictures to add to the scare factor.Overall, I still enjoy this collection of stories. I highly suggest giving them a shot.

I was originally pleased with the make of the washer but the connector between the washer and hose broke, when i ordered the replacement parts it took them over 1 "YEAR" to get the replacement parts to me. That is not a typo and i find it ignorant that it took that long to replace a plastic part that they should have had mass produced with plenty of spares. Do not buy, the customer service is horrible and the machine breaks easily, not to mention to get it fixed takes a year.

Not many films make me feel stupid for actually watching them, but this movie did. Despite starring LL Cool J (who generally happens to at least make stupid films entertaining) this film falls so far flat that it almost bows under and creates a ditch. Chris Klein is a horrendous actor and he manages to muddle up nearly everything he comes in contact with, and no matter how hot Rebecca Romijn-Stamos is (just Romijn now), she doesn't bring anything to this film outside of her body, and that just can't cut it. The violence is cheap, the script is preposterous and the action sequences feel third rate. This is one of those films that offer us absolutely nothing.I have nothing else to say about this.

A beautiful book. I love everything about it: crisp photography, nice paper, great ideas, an abundance of inspiring bon mots, lots of resources listed at the back of the book. After flipping through its pages, I wanted to jump off the sofa and begin journaling! But I didn't. I felt a little overwhelmed by the creative journal pages I saw. I just don't know where people get some of their amazing ideas. I wish my mind were half as fertile as those whose works are featured in the pages of "Making Journals by Hand." I will, however, continue enjoying the visual feast between its covers and hope for a divine intervention that will get me off the sofa and into the craft room to create a fabulous rememberance, just as the featured artists have done. If you like books, paper, art, rubber stamping, writing, color, cool ideas, and peeking into other people's journals, buy this book.
